properties.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 10:01AM CST until January 15 at 5:00PM CST by NWS Paducah KY
properties.description:
...The National Weather Service in Paducah, Kentucky has issued a
flood warning for the following rivers in Illinois...

Big Muddy River near Plumfield and Murphysboro

.River levels along the Big Muddy River are rising due to heavy
rainfall of 1 to 2 inches that has fallen over the past 24 hours
combined with additional heavy rain forecast over the next 36 hours.
Moderate flooding is forecast to develop at Murphysboro and minor
flooding is forecast to occur at Plumfield. River levels are forecast
to rise above flood stage this weekend with crests expected early to
mid next week.

The National Weather Service in Paducah, Kentucky has issued a

* Flood Warning for
the Big Muddy River near Plumfield.
* from Saturday evening to Wednesday afternoon.
* At  9:30 AM Friday the stage was 10.1 feet.
* Flood Stage is 20.0 feet.
* Minor flooding is forecast.
* Forecast...Rise above flood stage by tomorrow late evening and
continue to rise to near 23.5 feet by early Monday morning. The
river will fall below flood stage by Wednesday.
* Impact...At 20.0 Feet...Minor flooding occurs affecting mainly
bottomland and surrounding low lying areas.
properties.instruction:
SAFETY MESSAGE...

Never drive cars...trucks or sport utility vehicles through flooded
areas. The water may be too deep to allow safe passage. Never allow
children to play in or near flood waters. Stay tuned to NOAA Weather
Radio or your local media for further statements and possible updated
forecasts.

Additional information is available at
http://www.crh.noaa.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=pah /lower case/
